poem:
### Chalklands

The fields, mere whispers,  
spread breadcrumbs for the sky,  
where ruts harden into dusty lines—  
pale scars on the earth's skin.  
Rain-dark mud fades,  
softens to the grey of sighs,  
as horizons lean  
toward the promise of green,  
held captive  
in this chalk-white pause,  
this breath before blossom.
